etymology.description: phonetic: 且 (OC *sʰjaːʔ, *ʔsa) + semantic: 力 ("strong arm")
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of strength (力) with a phonetic cue from 且, evoking the notion of lending one’s strength to assist. The phonetic component reflects an older pronunciation; modern Mandarin zhù developed from those earlier readings.

examples.chinese: 请你帮助我完成作业(請你幫助我完成作業)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ bāngzhù wǒ wánchéng zuòyè.
examples.english: Please help me finish my homework.

examples.chinese: 他担任项目助理，协助团队沟通(他擔任項目助理，協助團隊溝通)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dānrèn xiàngmù zhùlǐ, xiézhù tuánduì gōutōng.
examples.english: He serves as a project assistant, helping the team communicate.

examples.chinese: 这笔资金将有助于推动科研(這筆資金將有助於推動科研)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bǐ zījīn jiāng yǒuzhù yú tuīdòng kēyán.
examples.english: This funding will help promote scientific research.
